pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1644914045](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14579/commits/164491404518fd1170bf8ab3a3becba7b3b3226b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ evalEval_CC`
`+ evalEval_add`
`+ evalEval_dvd`
`+ evalEval_finset_sum`
`+ evalEval_intCast`
`+ evalEval_list_prod`
`+ evalEval_mul`
`+ evalEval_multiset_prod`
`+ evalEval_natCast`
`+ evalEval_neg`
`+ evalEval_one`
`+ evalEval_pow`
`+ evalEval_prod`
`+ evalEval_smul`
`+ evalEval_sub`
`+ evalEval_sum`
`+ evalEval_surjective`
`+ evalEval_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

These are not strictly necessary, because we can just rewrite `evalEval` into `eval` (or into `evalEvalRingHom`), and apply the corresponding lemmas of `eval` (or of general ring maps), but are API that are "nice to have".

I noted, when doing this, that there are a few missing gaps in the API of `eval`, but I'll not touch them here.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10519687856/job/29147460358)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10519687856/job/29147460650)
I am surprised that most of the lemmas here are not `@[simp]`!

Ugh, this is not a simp lemma for MvPolynomial, but is for Polynomial. Given that inconsistency, I don't mind what happens here, but if you feel like looking into that later, that would be wonderful. :-)
Is it necessary to write OfNat.ofNat here, rather than just n?
I copied the corresponding lemma for `eval`. Without the `Ofnat.ofNat` this is the same as `evalEval_natCast`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Polynomial/Bivariate): add lemmas for bivariate polynomials
